Pre-Game Insights: Colombia have won their opening match in each of the last three editions of the Copa America
Colombia have not lost an international match in over two years
Paraguay have something to build on heading into this tournament, winning their final tune-up fixture
La Albirroja failing to find the back of the net in any of those previous encounters
Post-Match Reflections: Colombia won the match with a score of 2-1
Colombia's experience and momentum were enough to grind out a narrow victory
Miscellaneous Highlights: Colombia have been good when facing a deficit as well, though, coming back to win their previous three encounters when conceding the opening goal
Paraguay have emerged victorious the last three times that they have found the back of the net while failing to concede
Colombia's James Rodriguez collected his 100th cap with Colombia in their victory over Bolivia
